answers.answer: Neuropathy numbness pain in arms and legs can be referred pain from the spine.  Lack of Vitamin B group especially B12 - a blood test would show if the Vitamin B12 levels are low.Another reason for neuropathy numbness can be from nerve damage from uncontrolled sugar levels with someone who has diabetes.  An HbA1C blood test would show your average blood glucose levels over a period of 3 months.  Your doctor can also arrange for you to have a glucose test to find out if you have glucose intolerance.  Even before diabetes is confirmed, damage can happen to nerves.Loose stools can be a medical symptom, but also can be related to what you eat and drink.  If you drank a lot of fresh orange juice, for example, that would give you loose stools.Make an appointment to see your doctor to get those blood tests that I mentioned above and ask about getting nerve conduction tests done to see if there is any impingement on nerves in the spine.

I took prednisone for asthma and it started after that I have read this wouldn't cause neuropathy but I just got another round yesterday and immediately the pain has came back twice as bad it has been kept at bay until I took this.

I had a EMG and Nerve test done all came back normal. I had a liver function test done and it came back slightly elevated. The Neuro gave me Lyrica and sent me on my way. I am blown away by the way Drs do things its like I am wasting theyre time.

Vitamin B12 is a water soluble vitamin, this means that any excess that is taken in the day, will be excreted when you go to urinate.I know exactly what you mean by feeling like you are wasting the doctor's time.As you took/used the prednisone and your symptoms came back - this medication is not suiting you.  I too have a problem in that I cannot take some medications due to having adverse side effects.  I would suggest to keep off the prednisone and tell your doctor of your reaction to it.You should make an appointment to see your doctor to discuss the results of the elevated liver function - this may be due to some medications that you are on.Keep a note of how you get on with the Lyrica.  This medication also goes under the name of Pregabalin.  It is used for treating pain caused by neurologic diseases such as postherpetic neuralgia as well as seizures.  If it does not help you, you will need to get  back to your own doctor if you have been discharged by the Neuro.Best wishes.
I threw the lyrica away I really don't think I am taking anything else without a diagnosis. My vitamin b12 is double what it should be so I don't think that's it. I go to a new neuro on the 5th.

Just to make you aware that numbness and pins and needles can be caused by problems in the spine.  In depends which part of the spine has a problem to you feeling the pins and needles and numbness.For example numbness and pins and needles in your arms and fingers can be from problems the neck bones.Pins and needles and numbness in your legs and feet can come from problems in the lower spine.With allergies, it can be hard to pinpoint a specific thing that can cause this and sometimes there is more than one thing that can cause allergic reactions.Loose stools can be caused by what you eat, but also if you have an intolerance to some foods.  People usually have an intolerance to gluten in bread, cakes and biscuits and also lactose.  Lactose is sugar that is present in milk.Anxiety and stress can also cause loose stools due to worry.Keep a food diary and write down everything that you eat and drink and note the times when your loose stools problem is worse.  This will help you to identify a food allergy that you can then avoid.For allergies, your doctor can prescribe an antihistamine.  You can purchase these yourself without a prescription.If you new Neuro cannot find any cause, you should consider thinking about having imaging done on your bones.Let me know how you get on.Best wishes.
